results.title: Thailand: three village children
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Compares the lives of three children in Thailand, their family situation, their schooling and the work they have to do. No other credits available. Suitable for middle-upper Primary School.

results.title: The Philippines: talking pictures
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”
Filipino children’s paintings are intercut with live action showing aspects of the Philippines. The children responsible for the art work provide the commentary.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Philippines: two girls
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”
Shows the life of an Australian girl aged nine years living in the Philippines and contrasts it with that of a seventeen year old Filipino girl who is aiming at being a physical education teacher.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Philippines: finding water
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
An Australian drilling supervisor and his crew and a Filipino water diviner go to work in the yard of a village school in the Philippines. The children’s observations are recorded. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: On the river: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows the lifestyle of one Thai family on a large riverboat in Thailand. Also indicates the role of the river as a highway and the human habitation along the riverside. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Meo Village: Preparing food
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Looks at a particular Meo village and shows the types of food eaten, the way in which it is grown and how it is prepared.

results.title: Games: the Philippines
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows a variety of games played by Filipino children as well as toys made by them. Includes the indigenous and English names for the games. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions and Meat and Livestock Australia
results.brief_description: This series, produced for the Australian Meat Board, discusses different types of meat and shows how to obtain different cuts.

results.title: Bulk buy beef
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions and Meat and Livestock Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Meat makes the meal”.
This film clearly illustrates the variety of meat cuts available to the purchasers of bulk beef. The preparation of a side of beef from commercial cuts to domestic cuts to suit the preference of the purchaser is demonstrated. The advantages of home freezer use are emphasised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kingcroft Productions and Meat and Livestock Australia
